chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force
Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alec James Ryan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall receive 9 days presentence credit should supervision be revoked

miscConds.notes: Must obtain/maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both
Shall have no contact or communication with victim or Cole's BP; Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.
Shall write a letter of apology to victim & Cole's within 30 days and shall submit letter to agent & Court;   Shall submit a DNA sample
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges
